Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2008 03:18PM Monique42 wrote: Hi Lynn     I just did 6 tx of Taxotere, Herceptin and pemindronate(bone builder). I have quite of few liver lesions (biggest 1 1/2 inches) and bone mets in my skull, shoulders, ribs hips. I have worked through my treatments full-time.(nights/day shift) I have a family - husband and kids 11 and 9. The Taxotere is doable- Ive' had watery eyes, bleeding noses, swelling in both ankles and 1 arm due to infected nails- leaked- but I held my head up for battle and talked to the cancer saying - "Take that!! You weren't in my body when I was born and you don't belong there!!"  Sounds weird yeh??  I've prayed a lot.   When my scans came back just 2 wks ago to see what's going on.  My Liver tumor - big one- shrunk 1/2 inch and my bones are healing.  Yes healing!!!  I'm taking a break from the Taxotere for a couple of months to get healed up enough to take out the other inch in the liver.   Yes, chemo is tough, but everyone is different.  The 1st time I did Taxotere in 2001 I had no side effects other than a bit tired for a few days.   Lynn, Do battle think positive.  My moms friend is on her 10th year with liver and bone mets.  My friend also, they had given her 1 yr. - liver was full of mets - now liver is clear.   I think of my illness as chronic and everyday people are walking around with their diseases making the best of life.   I thank God everyday for my healings in my body. Lynn, put up your dukes and fight with us!!  Taxotere is doable                     Monique

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2008 08:21PM Monique42 wrote: Hi, Sierra, you will get wonderful support here. I sure did. I found out June 18/08 that I have Bone mets to skull, shoulders, ribs and spots on the liver.  I had a port inserted and chemo will start tomorrow for me. Taxatere and herceptin.  First diagnosed 2001 - stage 2 left side lobular, fx: taxotere chemo, tamoxafin,no nodes.  Then 2004- stage 3 right side - ductal, 1 node involvement. mastectomy, hysterectomy, FEC chemo, hercepting and aroumasin. Then this.  I really feel for all the people on this board who have to go through so much.  But I find my strength on this board and through God.  All this wonderful ladies and men are here for you honey and we are here for each other,to ask questions and fears and good old kick in the butt to get you motivated and believe positive as I do.  Their is alot of treatments out there, some will work for certain people and it won't work so well with others, but the doctors will find the right one for you.                                         take care                                                      Monique

Posts.Content: Monique42 wrote: Hi everyone,   I was 1st diagnosed with Stage 2 in 2001 no lymph nodes, then Stage 3 in 2004 with 1 out of 4 (SNB) lymph nodes, Grade 2 E++. Now they are doing scans because they say my liver scan is abnormal, it resembles liver mets or infection. But the nurse says we need to investigate further and only sometimes it's an infection. It's like I'm being prepared for the worse. They did a bone scan and CT of the chest and a muga ( I was on herception for a year along with aromasin).  I'm very nervous and can't seem to control my emotions. I find out tommorow. How did you all stay so brave for your family? I been reading the postings and all of your postings and they have been positive and that is the only thing right now keeping me going. I have no bone pain, or chest pain, shortness of breath. Can anyone help me feel a little better for tommorow?                  Monique, Canada (age 43)  Monique Dx 6/17/2008, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 1/4 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2009 07:37PM Monique42 wrote: I was on Tykerb and the same thing happened to me. My nails were lifting and got infected, yellow discharge were coming out and it stunk. My toe nails were pretty much falling and trying to see this also with tearry eyes(another side effect).  I was on antibiotics and kept my fingers dry by wearing gloves to do anything with water (dishes extra). Use hand sanitizer and avoid the nails. It only got better because I needed a break, I will resume in the fall again, but I will stay away from hot tubs or try not to keep my nails in any water.  Hope this helps

Posts.Content: Monique42 wrote: For the first time I was so happy to see my Onc. He told me my liver count has gone down a bit (only after 2 treatments), but it is still abnormal.  I was so happy I could have kissed him. He told me no hormonal tx will work only the chemo. I was still happy with that. He says we won't do a scan until after the 4 or 6th tx because the blood work is fine and hopefully the counts will go down.  I was so happy with the little news I got I forgot to ask him about the bone cancer.  I do have pressure points here and there but not really painful yet?  Can the bone cancer still progress even though my liver counts are down?? Posts.Title: Scar tissue in the Liver Monique42 X3sMom

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2008 01:39AM Monique42 wrote: Hi Lynn     I'm from Canada too and was diagnosed with bone and liver mets June 08. My doctor looked pretty gloomed too, but I think sometimes they are just sad to see us again. I did not have any scans either for 3 yrs after my 2nd diagnosis of breast cancer that showed 1 lymph node positive. I am on chemo because hormone drugs like Aromasin, Tamoxafin did not work for me in the past. I asked my doctor for a biopsy of the rib also, and he said there was no need as it was breast cancer and scans are pretty accurate.  I asked about ER.PR status and he said that it rarely changes and Her2 can be seen by blood work.  I was very upset too that scans were not performed in the past 3 yrs, but they state they will not do scan unless you have smyptoms, well I had no symptoms, little ach here, but just thought it was due to my work.  I had trouble trusting my Onc again, but sometimes I think it's not my Onc fault it's the systems fault and there rules on what the doctor can and cannot do as to regards with scans and such.  Monique - Winnipeg

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2008 03:45AM Monique42 wrote: Hi Lynn, I'm on the same one that you've started  (Aredia) or Pamidronte.  It is a strong bone builder, ( don't take calcium or Vit B ).  I'm on Taxotere and Herceptin too, because ANY hormone pill won't work for me. I have bone mets everywhere also.  Looking at your story reminds me of me - similiar diagnoses (except I have it in the liver as well).  I didn't know if I should work, I stopped buying things for myself because I thought what is the use. I was getting so depress and started to look for someone to blame - doctor - surgeon- didn't take enough tissue to begin with blah, blah, blah. Then I started going to work again and it made me feel better and I focus on living with cancer, then the ugly parts of cancer. Also the wonderful ladies who encourage us on this board gave me hope that we can live a life with cancer and possibly a longer life.   I work and I buy clothes(too much, need bigger closet), so point is Lynn, do what makes you happy- if you continue working that ok, if you stop and want to paint that is fine.
Posts.Title: I have Doctor Depressing,, I need your input LynnW Monique42

Posts.Content: Monique42 wrote: Hi I was just wondering?  I have liver mets and bone mets.  I've been on Herceptin only now since my last Chemo in Nov 2008. Onc decided to try Aromasin for 3 months. I had a bad reaction. I felt my liver grow harder and harder and I was very tired, bleeding nose.  I never felt anything in my liver before. ( I have lots of lesions). I took =aroumasiont for 1 1/2 months and Onc told me to stop.    I have always maintain to stay within my range for blood work. But now it is at the high range. ( Sorry I don't remember the count).   Here is the thing. I had a CT Scan of the liver and my Onc said that my liver tumors are pulsating causing scar tissue and he has difficulty seeing now.  WTF????   I'm still only on Herceptin.  Should I be more vigulent and ask to be on a oral chemo to shrink the tumors so they don't cause damage?? Does anyone else have scars in their liver from them pulsating? Thank you Monique Monique Dx 6/17/2008, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 1/4 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
